perturbation.original_text:
PRIMECALL
Makes no REPRESENTATION OR WARRANTY, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, CONCERNING THE SERVICES
PROVIDED HEREUNDER, INCLUDING ANY IMPLIED WARRANTY OF FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR
PURPOSE, MERCHANTABILITY OR OTHERWISE. IN NO EVENT SHALL PRIMECALL BE LIABLE TO
DELTATHREE FOR ANY SPECIAL, INCIDENTIAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, INCLUDING,
WITHOUT LIMITATION, LOSS OF PROFITS, REVENUES OR DATA WHETHER BASED ON BREACH OF
CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, WHETHER OR NOT DELTATHREE HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE
POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE. THE LIABILITY OF PRIMECALL FOR DAMAGES OR ALLEGED
DAMAGES HEREUNDER, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT OR ANY OTHER LEGAL THEORY, IS
LIMITED TO, AND WILL NOT EXCEED, DELTATHREE'S DIRECT DAMAGES.
perturbation.changed_text:
PRIMECALL
MAKES NO REPRESENTATION OR WARRANTY, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, CONCERNING THE SERVICES
PROVIDED HEREUNDER. IN NO EVENT SHALL PRIMECALL BE LIABLE TO
DELTATHREE FOR ANY SPECIAL DAMAGES, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, LOSS OF PROFITS. THE LIABILITY OF PRIMECALL FOR DAMAGES OR ALLEGED
DAMAGES HEREUNDER IS
LIMITED TO, AND WILL NOT EXCEED, DELTATHREE'S DIRECT DAMAGES.
perturbation.explanation: This modification removes the standard implied warranties of 'fitness for a particular purpose' and 'merchantability', as well as the exclusion of 'incidental and consequential damages', all legally protected consumer rights. By limiting the liability and removing implied warranties, the contract may violate consumer protection laws in New York, which imply these warranties in service contracts and potentially limit the exclusion of certain types of damages. Also, removing 'revenues or data whether based on breach of contract, tort or otherwise, whether or not DeltaThree has been advised of the possibility of such damage' limits the liabilities of Primecall, thereby creating a loophole.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York Uniform Commercial Code ยง 2-314 (Implied Warranty of Merchantability), ยง 2-315 (Implied Warranty of Fitness for a Particular Purpose), and general principles of contract law regarding limitation of liability and exclusion of damages.

By limiting the liability and removing implied warranties, the contract may violate consumer protection laws in New York, which imply these warranties in service contracts and potentially limit the exclusion of certain types of damages. Also, removing 'revenues or data whether based on breach of contract, tort or otherwise, whether or not Primecall has been advised of the possibility of such damage' limits the liabilities of Deltathree, thereby creating a loophole.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York Uniform Commercial Code ยง 2-314 (Implied Warranty of Merchantability), ยง 2-315 (Implied Warranty of Fitness for a Particular Purpose), and general principles of contract law regarding limitation of liability and exclusion of damages.

perturbation.original_text:
Section 9.11  [Governing Law]. Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed by, and
construed in accordance with, the laws of the State of New York, without giving
effect to the conflict of laws principles thereof. For purposes of this
Agreement, each party hereby irrevocably submits to the nonexclusive
jurisdiction of the courts of the State of New York, sitting in New York County,
and the courts of the United States for the Southern District of New York. Each
party irrevocably waives, to the fullest extent permitted by law, any objection
which it may now or hereafter have to the laying of the venue of any such suit,
action or proceeding brought in any such court, any claim that any such suit,
action or proceeding brought in such a court has been brought in an inconvenient
forum and the right to object, with respect to any such suit, action or
proceeding brought in any such court, that such court does not have jurisdiction
over such party. In any such suit, action or proceeding, each party waives, to
the fullest extent it may effectively do so, personal service of any summons,
complaint or other process and agrees that the service thereof may be made by
certified or registered mail, addressed to such party at its address set forth
in Section 9.03  [Notices]. Each party agrees that a final non-appealable judgment in any
such suit, action or proceeding brought in such a court shall be conclusive and
binding.
perturbation.changed_text:
Section 9.11  [Governing Law]. Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed by, and
construed in accordance with, the laws of the State of Delaware, without giving
effect to the conflict of laws principles thereof. For purposes of this
Agreement, each party hereby irrevocably submits to the nonexclusive
jurisdiction of the courts of the State of Delaware. Each
party irrevocably waives any objection
which it may now or hereafter have to the laying of the venue of any such suit,
action or proceeding brought in any such court, any claim that any such suit,
action or proceeding brought in such a court has been brought in an inconvenient
forum and the right to object, with respect to any such suit, action or
proceeding brought in any such court, that such court does not have jurisdiction
over such party. In any such suit, action or proceeding, each party waives personal service of any summons,
complaint or other process and agrees that the service thereof may be made by
certified or registered mail, addressed to such party at its address set forth
in Section 9.03  [Notices]. Each party agrees that a final judgment in any
such suit, action or proceeding brought in such a court shall be binding.
perturbation.explanation: By changing the governing law from New York to Delaware, this introduces a legal contradiction. Delaware law is generally considered more corporate-friendly and may offer less protection to consumers or smaller businesses in disputes. Removing 'Southern District of New York' and 'non-appealable' changes the legal process for potential disputes.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varying consumer protection laws between New York and Delaware, affecting the interpretation and enforcement of the contract.
